title: Sylvia Pankhurst
summary: Estelle Sylvia Pankhurst (5 May 1882 â€“ 27 September 1960) was an English campaigner for the suffrage and suffragette movement, a socialist and later a prominent left communist and activist in the cause of anti-fascism and the international auxiliary language movement.[1][2] She spent much of her later life campaigning on behalf of Ethiopia, where she eventually settled.
